creator: dyoung@origoservices.com
text:
In developing standards for the British insurance industry we have had many 
errors reported by Xerces on day elements due to Xerces requirement of the ---
NN format.

Most of the tools our Sponsors use to develop XML allow NN format for gDay, and 
although I realise the ISO standard requires the ---NN I believe the NN should 
also be correct.

Any comments?

creator: zongaro@ca.ibm.com
text:
I believe it's imperative that Xerces-J conform to the standard.  Although 
members of the British insurance industry might expect strings of the form NN 
to be permissible as gDay values, there's no guarantee that all other users 
would have a similar expectation; a program that was written with the 
expectation that any value validated against gDay has the form ---NN would 
behave incorrectly if it suddenly had to deal with values of the form NN as 
well.

A solution for that industry's purposes might be to define a type that is a 
union of gDay and a type that is a suitable restriction of the string type or 
positiveInteger type.

Otherwise, you really ought to raise this is a requirement to the XML Schema 
Working Group.
